title: ZnCl2 activated mesoporous carbon from rice straw: optimization of synthetic process and its application as highly efficient adsorbent for amoxicillin.
content:
Environ. Sci.: Water Res. Technol., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D4EW00171K, Paper
Suwiwat Sangon, Kanokwan Kotebantao, Theerakan Suyala, Yuvarat Ngernyen, Andrew J. Hunt, Nontipa Supanchaiyamat
An optimized and efficient zinc chloride (ZnCl2) chemical activation of rice straw yielded highly mesoporous carbons with exceptional ability to adsorb the antibiotic, amoxicillin (AMX). The maximum AMX adsorption capacity...
